intro: Bradburya virginiana var. flavida, commonly known as the yellow bradburya, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils along stream banks and in shaded woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often branched. This variant is distinguished by its vibrant yellow coloration, which sets it apart from other bradburya species.
